Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that there has been a recall on Kirkland Signature bath tissue at local Costco warehouses due to contamination with COVID-19. This is not true, as confirmed by Costco and the lack of a genuine recall notice.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no recall on Kirkland Signature bath tissue at Costco warehouses. Costco explicitly stated that the statement made in the claim is not true.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or genuine recall notice to substantiate the statement about the bath tissue recall.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the bath tissue is contaminated with COVID-19 due to being manufactured in China. This is a problematic assumption as there is no evidence or factual basis to support this claim.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation to the claim could be that the panic buying of toilet paper due to fears of the new coronavirus has led to the spread of false information and rumors about a bath tissue recall.
